poem:
**On Today's Whispers**

In the ripples of power,  
bands draw uneasy,  
Chagos beats in distant echoes;  
a kingdom's fingers  
brush the isles,  
while tongues in polished rooms spar;  
Old corridors hum and pulse,  
political dance—  
a living artifact,  
echoing promises—unsettled.  
Between each line,  
a nation's breath  
is held, released,  
in newsprint sighs.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK will allay Trump concerns over Chagos Islands, says minister, after Farage claims there is ‘hostility’ to deal – UK politics live 2.49pm GMT Labour criticise Badenoch for saying at PMQs she is not against extra spending measures in budget - while attacking NICs rise These are from Theo Bertram, a former Labour adviser in No 10 under Tony Blair and Gordon Brown, on social media on Kemi Badenoch’s performance at PMQs. Badenoch is still". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
